alert.note: Alert for Blue Earth; Brown; Watonwan (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 10 at 11:00PM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Brown, western Blue Earth and Watonwan Counties through 1145 PM CDT... At 1059 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Hanska, or 8 miles south of New Ulm, moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated, also measured 39 mph wind gust in New Ulm. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Courtland around 1105 PM CDT. Madelia around 1110 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Lake Crystal, Vernon Center and Good Thunder. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 14 between mile markers 102 and 103. U.S. Highway 169 between mile markers 26 and 55. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CDT for south central Minnesota.
